Posts.Content: Fantastic news, the best results you could have hoped for, praying I get the same results next week. I bet you feel so relieved and thankful that you now know the journey you have to take. Enjoy the sunshine today if you have it in your area and celebrate the good news. Sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Results Are In :)

Posts.Content: Hi Julie,  I haven’t had my results yet on my WLE & SNB ( tomorrow is results day) but I was told at my appointment that because of the size & type they think mine is plus my age(54) that some of my tumour may be sent to America for the Oncotype test & it will determine if I will have chemo or not. They think mine is grade 1, slow growing, 11mm, oestrogen receptive & not in the lymph nodes. I’m not certain but I think as your going straight to radio either you possibly didn’t have it or the results where good. Sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, just thought I would update you as I have had my results today & I am having the oncotype with the results of that in another 2 weeks.  The paperwork I have been given on the oncotype says that you may be a candidate if you are newly diagnosed with early stage invasive breast cancer that is both; Hormone receptor positive  HER2 negative  And my consultant says it is not offered everywhere. Sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Hi Julie,  Our lives are in their hands so we can only go with the flow & hope for the best outcome, as they say everyone’s journey is a different one. Sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, Probably a good idea to ask just do you have all the information, and I was told that it’s not standard at every hospital so I suppose there’s a possibility that you may not have had it.  As far as I’m aware it’s to do with the risk of the cancer coming back and the results you get from the onkotype would determine if you were at a higher risk do therefore chemo then radio, well that’s my understanding, maybe someone else with more knowledge may answer with more information as I am fairly new to this, but do like to get as much information as possible. I think if it oestrogen + then it is slower growing as well. Fingers crossed I get the same results as you tomorrow, that’s what I’m hoping for. Sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: I e been asked today what my Oncotype DX Test result was by a friend...

Posts.Content: Sorry I’ve not been on much lately but Ahhh well done @xjuliex trying to get back to normal, I’m still off at the moment and found out I’m getting made redundant in January so that’s finishing my year off well just remember to be kind to yourself & a little selfish sometimes if it’s needed, only you walks in your shoes. sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: First week back at work completed!!

Posts.Content: Great news your out the other end of the surgery, enjoy the sleep & the rest while the drugs are working. My op was 2 weeks yesterday for WLE & SNB and I’m feeling great & the 2 weeks have gone so quickly so enjoy the rest & do what your body tells you. Sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Home after lumpectomy

Posts.Content: Trying not to think of the ‘what if’s’ I’ve found is the easiest way to deal with it, deal with what you know for now and you can deal with the rest as & if it comes your way. We are stronger than we think I’ve found xxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Frillyflower, Mine was 12mm, just over 1cm and they don’t think it’s spread to my lymph nodes, I had my surgery 10th May, possibly your May be something like me. Surgery to remove the lump & the first lymph nodes just to check them. I had to be at the hospital for 10am & knew by surgery would be in the afternoon, had an ultrasound then an injection of the radioactive stuff, lots of chats with nurses, my surgeon etc. Was in theatre at 3pm & Home by 7.30, a bit sore & groggy but starving  Spent that night & the whole of the next day resting in bed but was pretty much ok after that. Just the wait now for the results & that’s probably harder than the surgery if I’m honest. My family have grown & moved out and my husband works shifts so lots of time on my own to ‘think’, I try my best to be as busy as possible when I’m on my own, right up until bedtime so hopefully I’m so tired I can get a decent sleep. This is all doeable as this site proves daily, just cry when you need to but don’t let this take anymore away from you than it has to, take back some of the control. Sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: Morning  Frillyflower & welcome. Your diagnosis sounds very similar to mine, routine mammogram, then recall where they done another mammogram, ultrasound & biopsy, dreaded 2 week wait for results of BC, 1cm ductal & looking like it’s not in my lymph nodes, diagnosed 18th April.  I had my surgery 10th May to remove the lump WLE ( wide local excision) and removal of the 1st lymph nodes SNB( sentinel node biopsy) and just waiting for the results of my surgery and forward plan on 30th May. Your treatment will possibly be something similar to mine, no doubt your mind is working overtime, I know mine did, but I will say so far things have been nowhere near as bad as I imagined, the waiting is possibly the hardest part as you feel out of control. Don’t google ANYTHING, just use the sites stated on here or your mind will explode. Good luck on this journey, I’ve only been on here a few days but just reading the posts make you smile, Sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed with breast cancer

Posts.Content: No8 for me today & I to am a little sore but underneath my boob, they have given me a cool pad thing to put on which seems to be helping with the little blisters, they told me not to use any creams etc while there are blisters just the cool pad  much quicker today & lined up quite easily so in & out wiped out today, even had an afternoon nap before my 5.30 appointment  good luck everyone & sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi @anjelb, hope your feeling a little better this morning, everything you’ve said is exactly the same as I had on day 3, then I was fine till day 6 which was more uncomfortable then my blisters appeared day 7 but although uncomfortable it’s tolerable. i was given a Macmillan booklet on radiotherapy & it stated no cooling aids to the radiated area although no one has actually told me that & I have been given a type of “cool pad” to apply to the blisters, seems every one & every area is different.  Hi @xjuliex  hope you doing ok & your skin is holding out I was a little more uncomfortable last night and very pink  but so far the skin around the blisters seems to be holding out with what they have done with the dressings, cream etc just hope it can last, day 11 for me today good luck to everyone with appointments etc today sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Well done to everyone who ‘Rang their bell’ how emotional does it feel im 6 days after now with a nice red blistered boob, it’s doing ok but the itching is driving me mental good luck to everyone going into the August thread with your treatment, hope you all get through this as unscathed as possible  sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Thanks @Leolady56 for the information, I have been using E45 after showers to try & help, just wondering which Aveeno that your all using? Also where did you get the Actiform pads from?  My oncologist said I would be given aqueous cream to use, has anyone used this before?  I’m sure I’ll be asking many more questions, this is such a great place to help you prepare. Glad to hear your all done, enjoy the rest now. Sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Thanks @toxophilite for the information, I have already tried to prepare a little by using E45 after showers but also wondering which Aveeno that your all using? My oncologist said I would be given aqueous cream to use?  Didn’t think about my back only getting radiotherapy to my left breast, no collarbone or underarm needed, so not sure how much will be affected, what did you need to do with the blistering?  Hope alls going well for you now. Sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: It was fine @Xjuliex like I said I didn’t even know it was fine, boob does feel a little odd today but that could be just in my head. im left side to & at the planning done the breathing perfectly well but struggled a little yesterday, she said my normal breathing pattern was to deep??? Hoping it was just nerves for the first go. good luck Monday, my appointment is 3.15 sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi @Israel, quite a few of us on the radiotherapy train for July already. I’ve just got some Aveeno & I have some Aloe Vera on order, just gonna try whatever it takes to help my skin, I’ve been using E45 for the last few weeks to try help but started with the Aveeno today. Lots of fluids I agree, just think we’re nearly out the other end. Sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Hi @taralou  good to hear that the arm thing got easier for you, on Friday I was lying with my arms up for over half an hour & I wanted to cry my left arm was completely dead and has been aching all weekend, I think that’s why Iouldn’t do the breathing thing properly as I was concentrating on my arm to much hopefully ill fo better tomorrow, are you having 15 as well?  I was told loads of do’s & dont’s  no shaving under my arm no swimming  no hot water directly on the breast  no deoderant, only special ones on a list nothing sented, only simple or baby soap i got given a tub of Aquamax Cream to use 2-3 times a day good luck for tomorrow  sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: I had No3 yesterday and was a little tender last night & this morning, my nipple is fine but where my scar is is throbbing, my scar is on the side of my boob and my lump wasn’t near the nipple as it was right against my chest wall. can only imagine it will get a little worse before it’s over sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: My appointment times are rubbish either 3.30 or 5.30 but like you @Aspen I’m only about 20minutes away but I’m either going to get caught in school or commuter traffic But I suppose it’s a small price to pay to be st the end of this journey. Hope it’s all good for everyone. Sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Well had my first zap today and I must say I didn’t even know it had been done. Biggest issue I had was having my arms above my head for so long I had lost all feelings in my hand but they said I shouldn’t be there as long on Monday as all my details are programmed in now  so 1 down, 14 to go  good luck everyone  sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: I had my 2nd zap yesterday & it was much easier & quicker than Friday had been so I’m feeling much more comfortable & eager to get them ticked off( No 3 today). i have been given 3 extra appointments before 3 of my treatments, 1st one tomorrow, 2 are skincare appointments & the other is a physio one?  Does anyone else have this or is it just in my area, I’m in the northwest? goodluck to all & sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: So my final radiotherapy No15 for me today, glad to be at the end but feeling a little apprehensive about no more hospital until my 1year mammogram, loosing the comfort of knowing they’ve “got you”  skin holding out so far, they said the dressings are doing their job good luck to everyone today, wherever in your journey you may be sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: I didn’t get asked at all I just got a letter with all 15 appointment dates & times, the earliest is 2.45 & the latest 6pm. Just was hoping for a similar time each day but hey hoe I suppose you just have to fit in as others finish their treatment. sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: So No7 for me today almost half way through, a little pink & feeling hot but onwards & upwards. good luck to everyone having treatments this week  sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: Oh @xjuliex that did make me giggle
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: I’m in, Radiotherapy starts Friday 6th July & finishes Thursday 26th, 15 sessions, a light at the end of my tunnel. Hope it goes ok, I’m a little apprehensive in respect of my skin holding out as I burn really easily when on holiday. Good luck to everyone. Sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: @Xjuliex we will probably be getting zapped at the same time i had my planning appointment at another site & did the breathing thing perfectly well but they were asking me to do it differently & the deep breath was fine, done that maybe twice or three times I think but it was my normal breathing they said I was breathing to deeply and needed to make my breaths more shallow. the little screen thing that you watch I needed to keep my breaths at the bottom but they were halfway up & I just couldn’t keep it low hopefully it goes well tomorrow, good luck, I’ll be thinking of you sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: I’m all done & “Rang that Bell” sooooo emotional i have follow up with the oncologist on the 5th September & a couple of appointments regarding lymphoedema  but moving forwards, spending quality time with my husband, daughters, grandkids & parents, making every moment count. i will still be visiting this site as I couldn’t have got through without it. good luck to everyone & their journey  sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: July 2018 Radiotherapy Club

Posts.Content: No I live in Skem, was originally with Wigan but my cousin had BC nearly 3years ago & she was with Aintree for her care & still is,so I swapped to them as I had only heard great things about them, only seen them for the first time April 25th & had my surgery May 10th, so far they have been Amazing xxx
Posts.Title: Letrozole Brands and side effects

Posts.Content: I’m with Aintree as well, Lee Martin did my surgery & I can only say great things so far about them xxx
Posts.Title: Letrozole Brands and side effects

Posts.Content: Hi @pickles18 my oncotype score was 16 so I went straight to radiotherapy after lumpectomy and hormone treatment for 5 years but my cousin had a mastectomy, no chemo or radiotherapy, 5 years hormone treatment and an oncotype score of 21 her oncologist advised her that he felt chemo would do more harm than good with her score. hope this can help your decision in some small way sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx test unclear as what i should do next :(

Posts.Content: Flipping heck taralou my hospital has 3 machines & one was off yesterday so everyone was completely behind their times, my appointment was 3pm & I only went in at 4.15 but they also had a problem lining me up ??? They left to do the thing but then came back in & said I wasn’t lined up properly but it was only the floor one so I was ok but they had to start moving the bed again to get the right place, they also forgot to give me the little screen to watch as I’m left side so I just had to guess with my breathing. the thing is it just stresses you out a little for the next one also as I expected my skin has started blistering & itching so I have 2 dressings on & hydrocortisone cream & antihistamines good luck to everyone today no 8 for me so just over half way through just hoping my skin holds out  sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Not 'lined up' No RT today - anyone else have this?

Posts.Content: Oh @taralou your having a rough time, the only good in it all is that it’s nearly the end of your journey i had No10 today, no more issues with lining up just the blisters on my skin, it is holding out so far as the skin hasn’t broken with the pads & cream etc I was given just hope it can hold out for the next 5 good luck for the rest, we’ll Soon be there  sending hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Not 'lined up' No RT today - anyone else have this?

Posts.Content: Hi @Ladyluck2018 I had the oncotype test done, it took 2weeks for the results to come back and my score was 16 so no need for chemo, thankfully for me, just 15 sessions of radiotherapy. Things in your area seem to happen really quickly as my operation was 10th May & my results 30th May, oncotype results 13th June & im just waiting to hear when my radiotherapy starts. Hope it all works out well for you to. Sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Oncotype Dx Test

Posts.Content: Hi @Xjuliex I know we have similar diagnosis & timeframes, my first oncologist appointment is this Wednesday coming. I started my tamoxifen after my last hospital appointment on the 13th so I know I’m only 12 days in but so far so good, I’ve felt a little queasy but that’s all, I take my tablet just after tea,making sure it’s just after I’ve eaten so around 6.30-7. God luck for the rads, I’ll be following your journey to get some ideas on what to possibly expect, hope it goes well. Sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: So sorry that your op has been postponed especially as the waiting is it hardest part of this journey, days & weeks generally fly by but when your waiting they seem to drag. Good luck for June 12th, and a speedy recovery. Xxx
Posts.Title: Op postponed!!

Posts.Content: @xjuliex you can message me anytime, as you say we are on similar paths at similar times so good in a way to know someone is walking that path with you, good luck for Friday oh & hope your little infection is all cleared up now. sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Oh @xjuliex I was saddened but relieved to see this post as it’s just exactly how I’m feeling 4 weeks after radiotherapy finished and I was beginning to feel like there was something else going on as I’m just soooooo tired, grumpy, emotional. im an early riser so I’ve been getting up early & trying to do some bits but by lunchtime I’m nackered to the point I couldn’t even blow dry my hair after a shower last week  I’m still off work to and was planning on going back next week on a phased return as we have a holiday booked ( booked before my diagnosis) for the 16th September so planned 2 weeks part time work en 2 weeks holiday then back full time after that but I just couldn’t possibly face it .  Its so hard having to think about having to return to work in all this poop but I must say my employers have been marvellous. hope you get something sorted soon. sending hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!
